intro: Roldana quezaltica, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils in open areas. It has hairy stems and oval-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Roldana quezaltica is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental beauty.
